intro: Pavetta hispidula var. siphonantha, commonly known as the rough pavetta, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers. The plant typically has hairy stems and leaves, giving it a rugged appearance. Its flowers are usually white or pale pink, and it produces small, spherical berries. It thrives in tropical and subtropical regions, often in moist, shaded environments.
